awd_titl_txt: The Integration of Numerical Analysis, Symbolic Computing   Computational Geometry and Artificial Intelligence for      Computational Science, Washington, DC, April 11-12, 1991.
awd_abstract_narration: Harnessing supercomputer power for computational engineering and                science will require massive software systems that support very high            level, applications-oriented problem solving environments (PSEs).  Such         PSEs will be constructed from software systems from four areas                  (Numerical Analysis, Symbolic Computing, Computational Geometry and             Artificial Intelligence) which interact currently in a very limited             way.  A symbiotic integration of ideas and software from these areas is         essential for creating the PSEs required in the future.                                                                                                         The purpose of this project is to hold a workshop consisting of 15-20           people from these areas for a two day intensive study of what has been          accomplished so far and to explore the potential for research                   developments over the next 4-8 years.  A report on the discussions and          conclusions will be prepared.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
